parent_formation: No. 243 Wing, No. 212 Group, Desert Air Force
base: Bu Amud, Libya (November-December 1942). Previous: LG.85 (October), LG.37 (October-November), LG.13 (November)

sources: Desert Air Force Wikipedia (Tier 2 - with citations)
History of War - No. 80 Squadron RAF (Tier 2)
Christopher Shores - Strike True: The Story of No. 80 Squadron RAF (reference)
North Africa Air Units Seed COMPLETE.json
metadata.notes: Hurricane IIc variant confirmed from multiple Tier 2 sources. Squadron strength of 16 aircraft confirmed from Desert Air Force organizational data. Commander name not accessible from available sources - would require RAF Operations Record Books (AIR 27 series at UK National Archives). Base locations confirmed for Q4 1942 from historyofwar.org. Squadron part of 243 Wing under 212 Group during El Alamein campaign and subsequent operations in Western Desert.

tier_1_2_sources_checked: Desert Air Force Wikipedia (with source citations)
Christopher Shores reference (Strike True book - cited but not directly accessed)
tier_1_2_facts_confirmed: Unit designation: No. 80 Squadron RAF (confirmed by historyofwar.org - Tier 2)
Aircraft type: Hawker Hurricane IIc (confirmed by Desert Air Force Wikipedia organizational data - Tier 2)
Squadron strength: 16 aircraft (confirmed by Desert Air Force Wikipedia - Tier 2)
Parent formation: 243 Wing, 212 Group (confirmed by Desert Air Force Wikipedia - Tier 2)
Base locations Q4 1942: LG.85, LG.37, LG.13, Bu Amud (confirmed by historyofwar.org - Tier 2)
Operational period: January 1942-April 1943 for Hurricane IIc (confirmed by historyofwar.org - Tier 2)
Quarter coverage: 1942-Q4 confirmed in North Africa (confirmed by multiple Tier 2 sources)
source_validation.tier_assignment_rationale: 75% of facts confirmed from Tier 2 sources (Desert Air Force Wikipedia with citations, historyofwar.org). Specific Hurricane IIc variant confirmed. Squadron strength of 16 aircraft confirmed. Base locations confirmed. Commander name requires Tier 1 source (RAF ORB) which was not accessible. Personnel numbers estimated from standard RAF fighter squadron establishment. Ordnance and supply data estimated from operational context and standard RAF practices.
